title: Air Pollution and GDP
research_question: Is there a significant relationship between Air Pollution and GDP per Capita?
data_source: PM2.5 and GDP per capita data by country (1990-2020)
methods: OLS regression with log transformation
main_finding: Higher log GDP is associated with lower air pollution (coef = -5 to -6, p < 0.001)

title: Teen Birth Rates
research_question: How does state economy and political leaning affect teen birth rates?
data_source: U.S. state-level GDP, teen birth rates, and political data (50 states)
methods: OLS regression with multiple predictors
main_finding: Republican states have 4.6 higher teen birth rate (p=0.001); GDP negatively associated (p=0.012)

title: GDP and Life Expectancy
research_question: Is there a relationship between GDP per Capita and Life Expectancy?
data_source: World Bank GDP and life expectancy data (2023)
methods: OLS regression with log transformation
main_finding: GDP per capita positively predicts life expectancy (p < 0.001)

title: GDP and Happiness
research_question: Is there a relationship between GDP per capita and happiness?
data_source: World Bank GDP and World Happiness Report 2024
methods: OLS regression with log transformation
main_finding: Log GDP strongly predicts happiness (coef = 1.83, p < 0.001, R² = 0.65)

title: MLB Attendance and Manager Change
research_question: Does winning affect MLB attendance?
data_source: MLB team data (150 team-season observations)
methods: OLS regression
main_finding: Each additional win is associated with a 0.67 percentage point increase in attendance (p < 0.001)

title: Mortgage Rates and Home Prices
research_question: Do U.S. mortgage interest rates affect home prices?
data_source: FRED - 30-Year Fixed Rate Mortgage (MORTGAGE30US) and Case-Shiller Home Price Index (CSUSHPINSA)
methods: OLS regression: Home_Price_Index ~ Mortgage_Rate
main_finding: Negative correlation between mortgage rates and home prices over time (time series caution applies)

title: Housing Prices and Rent Affordability
research_question: How Do Housing Price Changes Affect Rent Affordability Across U.S. Cities?
data_source: Zillow ZHVI (home values) and ZORI (rent) data for U.S. metros (2015-2024)
methods: Correlation analysis and OLS regression
main_finding: Housing price growth is positively correlated with rent increases across U.S. metros

title: Voter Turnout and Presidential Margins
research_question: What is the relationship between Voter Turnout and the Margin of U.S. Presidential Victories by County?
data_source: County presidential election results (2000-2024) merged with population estimates
methods: OLS regression with turnout as predictor
main_finding: Higher turnout is associated with slightly more Republican-leaning results (coef = -0.13, p < 0.001)

title: BMI and GDP on Life Expectancy
research_question: What are the effects of BMI and GDP on Life Expectancy?
data_source: WHO Life Expectancy dataset (2938 observations)
methods: OLS regression with log transformation
main_finding: A 10x increase in GDP is associated with ~10 years higher life expectancy (p < 0.001)

title: Income and Ticket Prices
research_question: Does Median household income have an impact on ticket prices?
data_source: U.S. median household income and ticket price index (1999-2024)
methods: OLS regression
main_finding: Each 1-point increase in ticket price index is associated with $129 higher median income (p < 0.001)

title: NYC Housing Price Growth
research_question: Which New York boroughs have the highest housing price growth?
data_source: NYC Department of Finance Rolling Sales Data (2024-2025)
methods: Chi-square test for independence and descriptive statistics
main_finding: Significant differences in price distributions across boroughs; Manhattan and Brooklyn have highest prices

title: NHL Teams and Tax Rates
research_question: Do NHL teams in low-tax states score more?

title: GDP and Voter Turnout
research_question: Does GDP have an effect on Voter turnout?
data_source: County-level GDP and unemployment data (presidential election years 2004-2020)
methods: OLS regression with year fixed effects and percent changes
main_finding: GDP percent change is NOT significantly associated with voter turnout change (p = 0.603)

title: Political Benefits and Unemployment
research_question: Is there a direct correlation between benefits given by a political party and unemployment rate?
data_source: U.S. state-level unemployment rates and maximum weekly unemployment benefits (2021 and 2025)
methods: OLS regression using first differences
main_finding: No significant relationship between change in benefits and change in unemployment (p = 0.291, R² = 0.02)

title: GDP Dentist Density and Healthcare
research_question: Does the relationship between log GDP per capita and density of dentists differ between countries with universal healthcare and countries without universal healthcare?
data_source: WHO dentist density and GDP per capita data (2020)
methods: OLS regression with interaction term
main_finding: Log GDP positively predicts dentist density (coef = 1.74, p < 0.001); interaction with UHC not significant

title: Minimum Wage and Presidential Results
research_question: Is state minimum wage linked to presidential results?

title: Health Spending and Life Expectancy
research_question: Is the amount of health spending in a country associated with life expectancy?
data_source: World Bank life expectancy and health expenditure per capita data (2022)
methods: OLS regression with log transformation
main_finding: Log health expenditure strongly predicts life expectancy (coef = 4.5 years per unit, p < 0.001, R² = 0.65)

title: The Olympics Effect
research_question: What is the Olympics Effect on host countries?
data_source: International tourist arrivals data from Our World in Data (1995-present)
methods: Time series visualization and trend analysis
main_finding: Tourism trends visible around Olympic years but causal effect requires more rigorous methodology

title: Sleep and Social Media
research_question: How are students' daily sleep affected by social media usage?
data_source: Students Social Media Addiction Survey (705 students)
methods: OLS regression: Sleep_Hours ~ Daily_Usage_Hours
main_finding: Negative relationship between social media usage and sleep hours

title: Major and Income
research_question: Does Undergraduate Major Impact Income?
data_source: IPUMS American Community Survey (2023) - 1 million person sample
methods: OLS regression with categorical major variable and age/education controls
main_finding: Major significantly predicts income. Engineering and Physical Sciences have highest premiums (R² = 0.54)

title: AI Computational Power
research_question: Does computational power required by AI models vary by domain?
data_source: Epoch AI dataset - AI model parameters and compute (PetaFLOPs)
methods: Log-log OLS regression with domain interaction terms
main_finding: Vision models require more compute per parameter than Language models (interaction p < 0.001)

title: S&P 500 and Inflation
research_question: Which S&P 500 sectors perform best when CPI inflation increases?

title: Regional Salary Differences
research_question: What are the regional differences in U.S. salaries: analyzing the impact of North vs South?
data_source: Bureau of Labor Statistics average weekly wage by state (2024)
methods: OLS regression with binary regional indicator
main_finding: No significant difference between North and South wages (p = 0.379, R² = 0.02)

title: F1 Pit Stops and Race Position
research_question: Does the Pit Stop time affect the Final Race position in F1?
data_source: F1 race data with pit stop times and final positions
methods: OLS regression of position on pit time
main_finding: Pit time NOT significantly associated with final position (p = 0.275)

title: Income Inequality and Incarceration
research_question: Is there a correlation between income inequality and incarceration rates across economically advanced countries?
data_source: Gini coefficients and incarceration rates for 12 developed countries
methods: OLS regression of incarceration on Gini
main_finding: Strong positive relationship: 0.01 Gini increase associated with 27.7 more prisoners/100k (R² = 0.58)

title: Restaurant Costs and Ratings
research_question: Do restaurants with higher average costs receive higher customer ratings?
data_source: Zomato restaurant dataset (~7000 restaurants)
methods: OLS regression of rating on average cost
main_finding: Positive but small effect: each cost unit = 0.0004 higher rating (p < 0.001, R² = 0.14)

title: Physical Activity and Academics
research_question: Is there a relationship between physical activity and academic performance in college-aged students?
data_source: Fitbit and Grades Data (Fall 2017) - 581 college students
methods: OLS regression with interaction term: GPA ~ Steps + Gender + Steps:Gender
main_finding: Positive relationship between steps and GPA (coef = 0.0001, p < 0.001, R² = 0.17)

title: MLB Salaries and Wins
research_question: Do Higher Team Salaries Lead to Higher Win Percentages in the MLB?
data_source: MLB team salary and win data (2024 season)
methods: OLS regression of win percentage on total salary
main_finding: Positive relationship: higher salaries associated with more wins (R² = 0.21)

title: Bus Stops and Home Values
research_question: Is there a relationship between the number of bus stops and median home value in Pittsburgh neighborhoods?
data_source: Pittsburgh transit stops and housing cost data by neighborhood
methods: OLS regression of median home value on bus stop count
main_finding: Each additional bus stop associated with ~$375 higher home value (p = 0.047)

title: Gender and Mental Health
research_question: Does gender affect depression and anxiety rates?
data_source: Student Mental Health Survey (~100 students)
methods: OLS regression (Linear Probability Model) of depression/anxiety on gender
main_finding: No significant relationship: depression p = 0.153, anxiety p = 0.553

title: Housing Prices and Birth Rates
research_question: How are changes in housing prices related to birth rates across U.S. states?
data_source: Zillow home values and state birth rate data (2023)
methods: OLS regression of fertility rate on median home value
main_finding: Negative relationship: higher home values associated with lower fertility (p = 0.006, R² = 0.15)

title: Height and Life Expectancy
research_question: Does your Height Have an Effect on Your Life Expectancy?
data_source: Our World in Data - Average height and life expectancy by country
methods: OLS regression of life expectancy on average height
main_finding: Positive relationship but likely confounded by development and nutrition

title: Wages and Immigration
research_question: Is there a relationship between wages earned and immigration status?
data_source: IPUMS Current Population Survey (CPS) - 536,569 observations (2015-2025)
methods: OLS regression: log(wage) ~ immigrant + education + age + year
main_finding: Immigrant coefficient = -0.016 (~1.6% lower wages) but NOT significant (p = 0.061)

title: Minimum Wage and Unemployment
research_question: What is the relationship between minimum wage and the unemployment rate?
data_source: State-level minimum wage and unemployment rate data (2024)
methods: OLS regression of unemployment rate on minimum wage
main_finding: Positive correlation (r = 0.35) but causation unclear due to confounding

title: NIL and College Football
research_question: Does NIL Investment Correlate to College Football Success?

title: Education and Income
research_question: Is there a relationship between education level and expected income?
data_source: IPUMS American Community Survey (2023) - 613,212 observations
methods: OLS regression of total income on education level
main_finding: Each unit of education = $7,431 higher income (p < 0.001, R² = 0.174)

title: Gender Wage Gap
research_question: Does the gender wage gap change when controlling for job title?
data_source: Glassdoor Gender Pay Gap dataset
methods: OLS regression with categorical controls
main_finding: Raw 9.5% gap disappears when controlling for job title

title: School Spending and Test Scores
research_question: Do higher spending schools see higher test scores?
data_source: NAEP Math Scores (2022) and School Expenditure Data by State
methods: OLS regression of test scores on expenditures per pupil
main_finding: No significant relationship (8th grade p = 0.632, 4th grade p = 0.335)

title: Maple Trees
research_question: Which Maple Is Best?
data_source: Pittsburgh Trees dataset (45709 trees)
methods: OLS regression with interaction term
main_finding: Norway Maples provide ~$10.58 more benefits and gain more per unit volume (interaction p < 0.001)

title: Urban-Rural Polarization
research_question: How has Democratic vote share in US Presidential Elections changed across counties from 2000 to 2016, and do these trends point to widening urban-rural polarization?
data_source: County presidential election results 2000-2024
methods: OLS with interaction term
main_finding: Positive interaction (0.019, p<0.001) confirms widening urban-rural polarization

title: CPI and S&P 500
research_question: Does CPI Correlate With S&P 500 Returns?
data_source: FRED - CPI percent change and S&P 500 index (monthly data)
methods: OLS regression of S&P 500 level on CPI inflation rate
main_finding: Negative relationship (coef = -166.28, p < 0.001, R² = 0.29)

title: Corruption and Income Inequality
research_question: Is there a relationship between corruption perception and income inequality across countries?
data_source: Transparency International CPI and World Bank GINI (180 countries)
methods: OLS regression of GINI on corruption perception
main_finding: Positive relationship (coef = 0.0018, p < 0.001, R² = 0.155)

title: NBA Draft Position
research_question: Does Draft Position Predict NBA Player Success?
data_source: NBA draft picks and BPM statistics (2010-2025)
methods: OLS regression of BPM on draft pick number
main_finding: Negative relationship: higher picks have better performance

title: Gas Prices and Consumer Sentiment
research_question: Is an increase in gas prices associated with a subsequent decrease in consumer sentiment?
data_source: FRED - Gas prices, Consumer Sentiment, Food CPI (monthly 2000-present)
methods: OLS with lagged sentiment: next month change ~ this month gas change
main_finding: Negative but not significant (coef = -2.53, p = 0.080)

title: MLB Payroll and Attendance
research_question: To what extent do payroll and fan attendance predict the number of wins for MLB teams?
data_source: MLB team statistics (payroll, attendance, wins)
methods: Multiple regression: Wins ~ Payroll_Pct + Average_Attendance
main_finding: Both predict wins (Payroll: 2.06, p < 0.001; Attendance: 0.44, p < 0.001)

title: GINI and Life Expectancy
research_question: Does income inequality (GINI) predict life expectancy across countries?
data_source: Our World in Data - GINI coefficient and life expectancy
methods: OLS regression of life expectancy on GINI coefficient
main_finding: Negative relationship (coef = -33.35, p < 0.001, R² = 0.138)

title: Urbanization and Voter Turnout
research_question: How did levels of urbanization across Virginia counties shape voter turnout in the 2025 gubernatorial election?

title: Political Affiliation and Minimum Wage
research_question: Is there a relationship between a state's political affiliation and its minimum wage?
data_source: Synthetic state-level data based on original analysis (50 states)
methods: OLS regression with categorical political affiliation: Minimum_Wage ~ Political_Affiliation + Cost_of_Living
main_finding: Red states have $4.20 lower minimum wage than blue states (p < 0.001, R² = 0.55)

title: Bus Boardings Weekday vs Weekend
research_question: Do average bus boardings per stop differ significantly between weekdays and weekends?
data_source: WPRDC Pittsburgh bus stop ridership data (107,611 observations)
methods: OLS regression with log transformation: log(boardings) ~ serviceday
main_finding: Weekend boardings are ~17% lower than weekday (coef = -0.19, p < 0.001)

title: Tuition and Enrollment
research_question: How Do Changes in In-State Tuition Affect Changes in Undergraduate Enrollment, and Does This Relationship Differ Between Public and Private Institutions?
data_source: IPEDS tuition and enrollment data (2016 and 2023)
methods: OLS regression with arcsinh transformation and interaction term
main_finding: Tuition-enrollment relationship differs by institution type; public institutions show a more negative effect (interaction p = 0.09)

title: Hotel Ratings by Room Type
research_question: Is there a difference in hotel ratings between two different room classifications (Economy and Luxury)?
data_source: Hotel pricing and rating data (108 hotels)
methods: OLS regression with categorical variable: Rating ~ Room_Class
main_finding: Luxury hotels have significantly higher ratings than Economy hotels

title: NFL Scoring and Weather
research_question: How does NFL scoring relate to bad weather days?
data_source: 2024 NFL game data including point totals and weather conditions
methods: OLS regression with binary weather variable: Point_Total ~ Bad_Weather
main_finding: Bad weather reduces scoring by ~4.3 points per game (p = 0.004)

title: Minimum Wage and Voter Turnout
research_question: Is there a relationship between minimum wage and voter turnout?
data_source: State-level election turnout data (1984-2024) with minimum wage and median income
methods: Multiple regression: Voter_Turnout ~ Minimum_Wage + Median_Household_Income
main_finding: No significant relationship (coef = 0.15, p = 0.38, R² = 0.008)

title: Minimum Wage and PA Inflation
research_question: Does a minimum wage increase in Pennsylvania contribute to higher inflation rate?
data_source: FRED - Pennsylvania minimum wage (STTMINWGPA) and CPI (CPIAUCSL) 2015-2025
methods: OLS regression: CPI ~ PA_Min_Wage
main_finding: CANNOT TEST: PA minimum wage remained constant at $7.25 throughout period - no variation in X

title: Income and Life Expectancy
research_question: Is higher household income associated with a longer life expectancy?
data_source: Health Inequality Project data (Chetty et al.)
methods: OLS regression with log transformation and interaction term
main_finding: Log income predicts life expectancy (coef = 1.79, p < 0.001); men show steeper gradient (interaction = 1.10, p < 0.001)

title: Gas Prices and Consumer Spending
research_question: What is the effect of Gas Prices on Consumer Spending in the US?
data_source: FRED - Gas prices (GASREGW), Real PCE (PCECC96), Unemployment (UNRATE) 2000-2024
methods: Multiple regression: Real_PCE ~ Gas_Price + Unemployment_Rate
main_finding: Positive relationship (coef = 1386, p < 0.001, R² = 0.42) but likely spurious due to time trend confound

title: MLB Payroll Success Rate
research_question: What is the MLB Payroll Success Rate? Does higher payroll lead to more wins?
data_source: MLB team payroll and win/loss data (2010-2024)
methods: OLS regression: Win_Loss_Ratio ~ Total_Payroll (and Active_Roster variant)
main_finding: Positive but weak relationship (R² = 0.11); Active roster payroll better predictor (R² = 0.24)

title: Beach Replenishment and Home Values
research_question: Does beach replenishment spending affect home values in NJ coastal towns?
data_source: Army Corps beach restoration spending (2000-2024) and Zillow home values (25 NJ beach towns)
methods: OLS regression: Percentage_Increase ~ Spending_Per_Mile
main_finding: Positive but not significant relationship between beach spending and home price appreciation

title: MLB Payroll and Wins
research_question: Is there a relationship between an MLB team's payroll and the amount of games they win?
data_source: MLB team payroll and win data (30 teams)
methods: OLS regression: Wins ~ Payroll_Millions
main_finding: Positive relationship between payroll and wins

title: QB College Years and NFL Contract
research_question: Does the number of years a quarterback plays in college predict their largest NFL contract (Success)?
data_source: NFL quarterback contract and college career data (34 QBs, 2016-2024)
methods: OLS regression: Contract_Millions ~ Years_in_College
main_finding: No significant relationship between college years and NFL contract size (p = 0.637, R² = 0.007)

title: Minimum Wage and Fast Food
research_question: How does Minimum Wage affect the Fast Food Industry?
data_source: State-level minimum wage and fast food employment data (51 states/DC)
methods: OLS regression: Employment ~ Min_Wage
main_finding: Cross-sectional analysis confounded by population - larger states have both higher wages and more employment

title: Room Sizes and Housing Prices
research_question: What is the Impact of Room Sizes on Housing Prices?
data_source: Boston Housing dataset (506 observations)
methods: OLS regression: MEDV ~ RM
main_finding: Strong positive relationship between rooms and price (coef = 9.10, p < 0.001, R² = 0.48)

title: Olympics and GDP
research_question: Is there a relationship between a country's Olympic medal count and GDP per capita?
data_source: Olympic medal counts and GDP per capita changes (87 countries)
methods: OLS regression using first differences: Medal_Change ~ GDP_Change
main_finding: No significant relationship between GDP changes and medal changes (p = 0.394, R² = 0.009)

title: ACC Football Attendance and Winning
research_question: Does average attendance for a football team in the ACC correlate to a higher winning percentage?
data_source: ACC Football team attendance and winning percentage data (2024 season, 17 teams)
methods: OLS regression: Winning_Pct ~ Attendance
main_finding: No significant relationship between attendance and winning (p = 0.52, R² = 0.028)

title: Unemployment and Opiate Overdose
research_question: What is the relationship between Unemployment Rates and Opiate Overdose Rates in the US?
data_source: FRED unemployment rate (UNRATE) and CDC opioid overdose death rates (1999-2020)
methods: OLS regression: Opioid_Deaths_per_100k ~ Unemployment_Rate
main_finding: No significant relationship between unemployment and opioid deaths (p = 0.842, R² = 0.002)

title: Income and PA Voter Turnout 2024
research_question: Did Income Influence Voter Turnout in Pennsylvania During the 2024 Presidential Election?
data_source: Pennsylvania county-level income and 2024 voter turnout data (66 counties)
methods: OLS regression: Voter_Turnout ~ Income
main_finding: Significant positive relationship between income and voter turnout (p < 0.001, R² = 0.265)

title: Inflation and Holiday Sales
research_question: How does November inflation affect the U.S. Holiday Sales?
data_source: Holiday sales and November CPI data (2004-2024)
methods: First-differences OLS regression
main_finding: 1 percentage point increase in inflation change is associated with $6.07B increase in sales change (p = 0.019)
